p: Of course, when the bovine spongiform encephalopathy epidemic spread across the UK in the 1990s [ 24] and public health concerns started to rise, the early studies on scrapie provided a critical intellectual framework (although possibly misleading with respect to potential human transmission) to understand the biology of bovine spongiform encephalopathy and the zoonotic variant Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease [ 25, 26].
